output_examples.input: My data-wp-interactive element is not responding to clicks. What could be wrong?
output: • viewScriptModule is not enqueued or loaded (check network tab)
• Missing data-wp-interactive attribute on the root element
• Store namespace mismatch between markup and store definition
• Ensure server-rendered markup matches client expectations

best_practices: Use the official @wordpress/create-block-interactive-template for new interactive blocks
Keep directive usage minimal and scoped to specific interactive regions
Ensure server-rendered markup and client hydration state align
Use unique directive IDs with the --- separator when multiple plugins attach handlers to the same element
anti_patterns: Overly broad interactive roots covering entire page
Assuming state persists across client-side navigation without reactive store usage
Duplicate directive attributes without unique IDs causing conflicts

faq.question: Which WordPress versions support the Interactivity API?
faq.answer: The Interactivity API is available in WordPress 6.5+. Full module support requires WordPress 6.9+.

faq.question: What is the difference between data-wp-interactive and data-wp-context?
faq.answer: data-wp-interactive declares an interactive region and store namespace. data-wp-context provides server-rendered initial state.

faq.question: How do I debug why my directives are not firing?
faq.answer: Check if viewScriptModule loads, confirm data-wp-interactive exists, verify store namespace matches, and check browser console for errors.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using this skill?
faq.answer: Yes. This skill only reads its own documentation files. It cannot access your project files, execute code, or make network requests.

faq.question: Can this skill run WP-CLI commands?
faq.answer: No. This skill provides guidance only. Users must run WP-CLI commands themselves in their WordPress environment.

faq.question: How does this compare to general WordPress development skills?
faq.answer: This skill specializes specifically in the Interactivity API. General WordPress skills cover broader topics like REST API, hooks, and theme development.
